concise_definition: adj. 被剥去的, 被剥夺的; v. 剥去, 剥夺 (strip 的过去式和过去分词)

definitions.explanation_en: Having had something essential or valuable removed or taken away, often leaving something bare, minimal, or deprived.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某物或某人被移除了关键或有价值的部分，通常变得赤裸、简陋或被剥夺。
definitions.example_en: The stripped-down version of the car had no air conditioning or radio.
definitions.example_cn: 这款简化版汽车没有空调和收音机。

definitions.explanation_en: Used to describe data, text, or content that has been cleaned of formatting, decorations, or unnecessary elements to reveal its core structure.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于描述经过清理格式、装饰或冗余元素后，仅保留核心结构的数据、文本或内容。
definitions.example_en: He pasted the stripped text into the plain text editor to avoid formatting conflicts.
definitions.example_cn: 他将去格式化的文本粘贴到纯文本编辑器中，以避免格式冲突。

definitions.explanation_en: To remove clothing, coverings, or outer layers from someone or something, often forcibly or completely.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指强行或彻底地将某人或某物的衣物、覆盖物或外层剥去。
definitions.example_en: The soldiers were stripped of their uniforms after the court-martial.
definitions.example_cn: 军事法庭判决后，士兵们被剥去了军装。

definitions.explanation_en: To deprive someone of something valuable, such as rights, power, possessions, or dignity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指剥夺某人有价值的东西，如权利、权力、财产或尊严。
definitions.example_en: The corrupt official was stripped of his title and pension.
definitions.example_cn: 这名腐败官员被剥夺了头衔和养老金。

comparison.analysis: “Bare” (赤裸的) 强调缺乏覆盖物或装饰，通常指物理状态的空无，如 bare walls 或 bare feet。而 “stripped” 暗示了主动的、有时是强制性的去除过程，带有剥夺或简化意图，语义更强烈且常含负面色彩。
“Removed” (移除) 是一个中性词，泛指任何事物被拿走，不强调方式或后果。而 “stripped” 通常暗示彻底性、系统性或暴力性地清除，常用于强调损失或简化后的状态，语义更具体、更具情感色彩。
“Deprived” (被剥夺的) 与 “stripped” 在抽象语境中（如权利、资源）高度重叠，但 “deprived” 更常用于描述长期的社会或经济状态（如 deprived communities），而 “stripped” 更强调一次性、主动的剥夺行为，动作感更强。
